comment: This object is for commenting purpose only.
The "FO": ["subsys",...] array defines that the value of FO must be
in fully sync in all defined subsystems.
By fully sync it means:
* If FO is yes, subsystems to be checked MUST also register the
corresponding entry and the value must be yes.
* If FO is no, the behavior is the same as non-mandatory checks: target
subsystem MUST not register the option with value "yes". If target
subsystem has no corresponding option, it is fine.
* If FO is not registered, it's considered a "no" entry and share the
same rule above.
* If FO is neither "yes" or "no", the value of FO must be in sync
Compared with default check logic, the only difference is the stricker
"FO=yes" rule.
SUPPORTED SUBSYSTEM STRINGS
* kernel
* lk
* preloader
* scp
* sspm
